metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart meets with her old friend once again. Talking about the past and discussing what the future is going to look like. Nocturne is a MtF transgender character, which Shadowheart may realise after piecing together information from a fragmented memory she recalled before.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Be shadowheart avatar or shadowheart companion by herself2. Talk to Nightshade.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *This seems to be the person from the memory recovered by eating the noblestalk - but changed, and with a different name.*

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: I... I remember you. But you're different. Very different. And that name is new.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: Most would consider us enemies, not friends.

87.speaker: Nocturne
87.text: Shadowheart... I wasn't sure if I'd ever lay eyes on you again. It's me, Nocturne. Do you remember?

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You recall the memory you recovered by eating the noblestalk - part of you understands that this is the same person you saw, but different, and with a new name.*

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: I... I remember you. But you're different. Very different. And that name is new.

24.speaker: Nocturne
24.text: Not that new. You inspired me to do it, actually.

49.speaker: Nocturne
49.text: I remember the other initiates used to tease you about your name - the one you chose to honour Lady Shar. But I never found it funny...

86.speaker: Nocturne
86.text: They were attacking who you were. I never found it funny, but wasn't quite sure why. Eventually I realised it was because I wasn't happy with who I was.

98.speaker: Nocturne
98.text: I couldn't keep going like that. But seeing how you fought on, I realised that I didn't have to. From then on, I was Nocturne. It wasn't easy... but everything started to make sense. I could breathe.

32.speaker: Nocturne
32.text: Not as glad as I am.

57.speaker: Nocturne
57.text: But enough of that - I can't believe you're back.

64.speaker: Nocturne
64.text: They... they whispered it was a suicide mission, this search for the artefact you were sent on. Some even thought it was the Mother Superior's plan alone, and not what Lady Shar wanted...

23.speaker: Nocturne
23.text: It seems the whispers were right on that last part, my lady. At some point she confused her ambitions for the Nightsinger's will.

44.speaker: Nocturne
44.text: But no matter - you rule us now. What comes next?

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: What comes next? My rule over this place. You will resume your duties.

29.speaker: Nocturne
29.text: I serve as quartermaster - see me whenever you seek supplies. And perhaps we could catch up... If you wish, of course.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: Viconia's gone, and this place can rot as far as I'm concerned. You should leave.

26.speaker: Nocturne
26.text: She is gone, but the Dark Lady is always with me. Perhaps there's another enclave out there for me.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: What comes next? The Chamber of Loss. Viconia is gone, and soon I will rule.

92.speaker: Nocturne
92.text: Then you are more than a friend - you are soon to be my leader, my lady.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: I did not see you amongst my supporters when I faced Viconia - can I trust you?

12.speaker: Nocturne
12.text: Of course. I am just a quartermaster - I would have been little use to you in battle.

80.speaker: Nocturne
80.text: But at least my wares can still aid you. Come to me whenever you need supplies... and perhaps we can catch up as well.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Most would consider us enemies, not friends.

34.speaker: Nocturne
34.text: Most, but not me. You may not remember, but we shared a lot together once. Good times, hard times... I will not turn on you. Even if it angers Lady Shar.

8.speaker: Nocturne
8.text: But I can imagine that is hard to believe. Give me a day, and I'll leave here. You'll never be troubled by me again.

70.speaker: Nocturne
70.text: Come see me before then, if you wish. I was working as quartermaster. I can sell you some things to aid you... and we can catch up.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: If we were - are - friends, there must be all sorts of things you could tell me.

22.speaker: Nocturne
22.text: There are... but you need to finish what you came here for. Everyone knows you've been blessed, that you're coming for the Mother Superior. I won't stand in your way.

11.speaker: Nocturne
11.text: Still, we need to be careful... The Mother Superior holds a tight grip on this place. But perhaps I can help you in the meanwhile.

75.speaker: Nocturne
75.text: Come see me when you have time - I work as quartermaster now. I can sell you some things... and we can catch up.

37.speaker: Nocturne
37.text: If you wish it of me... of course. I work as the quartermaster. Come see me whenever you wish.

3.speaker: Nocturne
3.text: There are... but you need to finish what you came here for. If half of the rumours about what was done to you are true... well, I won't stand in your way.

61.speaker: Nocturne
61.text: Still, we need to be careful... The Mother Superior holds a tight grip on this place. But perhaps I can help you in the meanwhile.

15.speaker: Nocturne
15.text: Come see me when you have time - I work as quartermaster now. I can sell you some things... and we can catch up.

5.speaker: Nocturne
5.text: There are... but with the Mother Superior gone, I don't know if I can stay here to reminisce. Perhaps there's another enclave out there for me.

62.speaker: Nocturne
62.text: You may be free of the Dark Lady, but not everyone is as brave. I'm afraid.

43.speaker: Nocturne
43.text: I'll leave come tomorrow. Come see me before then - I was working as quartermaster. I can sell you some things to aid you... and we can catch up.

42.speaker: Nocturne
42.text: It seems the whispers were right, on that last part. At some point she confused her ambitions for the Nightsinger's will.

85.speaker: Nocturne
85.text: Be careful... Whatever she has planned, I don't think she'll shed any tears if you were a casualty along the way.

99.speaker: Nocturne
99.text: Perhaps I can aid you all the same - it seems the Dark Lady holds you in high favour.

45.speaker: Nocturne
45.text: But now it seems you've turned on both the Mother Superior and Lady Shar...

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Most would consider us enemies, not friends.

90.speaker: Nocturne
90.text: Every way you can imagine. Scorn, indifference, acceptance, confusion. Some tried to taunt me, attack me... but luckily I learned a few tricks from you about how to handle them.

27.speaker: Nocturne
27.text: I must give the Mother Superior due credit, though. She accepted it with a nod. 'The Dark Lady guides us all,' she said. 'We find our true selves in her embrace.'

65.speaker: Nocturne
65.text: Do I detect a trace of scepticism? I know it might be hard to believe, but you can find acceptance in the unlikeliest of places.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: Perhaps she was telling you what you wanted to hear. To keep you bound to Shar.

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: Perhaps she was telling you what you wanted to hear. To keep you in Lady Shar's embrace.

31.speaker: Nocturne
31.text: It's possible - don't think I haven't considered it. But to find a home, to find acceptance for who I am... that is no small thing.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Shar is evil. She ruins lives. The acceptance of her disciple is nothing worth cherishing.

7.speaker: Nocturne
7.text: I am under no illusions about the nature of our creed. But to find a home, to find acceptance for who I am... that is no small thing.
7.context: NodeContext: A little tough. 'you don't need to explain the sky's blue'

71.speaker: Nocturne
71.text: I do not wish to argue the point. I'm too glad to see you for that.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: I remember none of this - or at least, almost none of it.

100.speaker: Nocturne
100.text: I understand. Allow me to remember for the both of us - it changed my life for the better.

55.speaker: Nocturne
55.text: We... we trained together. We used to be close.

19.speaker: Nocturne
19.text: I'm glad to see you're all right, even if you don't remember me.

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: Nocturne? Can't say I know you. Interesting name, though.

63.speaker: Nocturne
63.text: I keep forgetting how little you must remember - you inspired the name, actually.
